com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core

Interface IFactorTable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, IFactorTableBase, java.lang.Iterable<FactorTableEntry>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FactorTable, FactorTableBase, SparseFactorTable, SparseFactorTableBase

    public interface IFactorTable
extends IFactorTableBase

      • clone

        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Returns a deep copy of this factor table.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface IFactorTableBase

      • compact

        int compact()
        Removes entries from sparse representation of table that have zero weights.

        This may affect the IFactorTableBase.sparseSize() and the relationship between sparse and joint indexes.

        Returns:
        the number of sparse entries that were removed.

      • convert

        IFactorTable convert(JointDomainReindexer converter)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Returns a new factor table converted from this one using the specified converter.
        Specified by:

      • copy

        void copy(IFactorTable that)

      • createTableConditionedOn

        IFactorTable createTableConditionedOn(int[] valueIndices)
        Constructs a new factor table by conditioning one or more dimensions conditioned on specified values.

        The new table will not be directed and will have the same representation as the original table except that FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC will become FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY.

        Parameters:
        valueIndices - is an array of length IFactorTableBase.getDimensions() that specifies which dimensions are to be conditioned away. Each entry in the array should either be a negative value if the dimension is to be retained, or a non-negative value in the range [0, dimension-size - 1].
        Since:
        0.05

      • createTableWithNewVariables

        IFactorTable createTableWithNewVariables(DiscreteDomain[] newDomains)
        Constructs a new factor table by appending dimensions for the specified newDomains.

      • getRepresentation

        FactorTableRepresentation getRepresentation()
        Returns an enum indicating the underlying representation of the factor table.

        The representation may be changed via setRepresentation(FactorTableRepresentation) but can also be changed implicitly as a side effect of certain other methods:

        • getEnergiesSparseUnsafe()
        • IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForSparseIndex(int)
        • getIndicesSparseUnsafe()
        • getWeightForSparseIndex(int)
        • getWeightsSparseUnsafe()
        • setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)
        • setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int)
        • setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)
        • setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int)
        • IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromJointIndex(int)
        • IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexToJointIndex(int)

      • joinVariablesAndCreateNewTable

        IFactorTable joinVariablesAndCreateNewTable(int[] varIndices,
                                          int[] indexToJointIndex,
                                          DiscreteDomain[] allDomains,
                                          DiscreteDomain jointDomain)
        Creates a new factor table that replaces two or more of its domains with a joint domain.

        Parameters:
        varIndices - contains the indices of the domains to be joined. Must have at least two entries in the range [0,IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()-1].
        indexToJointIndex - specifies the order in which the joined domains are to be incorporated into the new joint domain.
        allDomains - is the list of all domains before joining
        jointDomain - is the new joined domain. Its size must match the product of the sizes of the joined domains, and it is expected to be of type JointDiscreteDomain. It will be the last domain in the new table's domain list.

      • hasDeterministicRepresentation

        boolean hasDeterministicRepresentation()
        True if table currently has a deterministic directed representation (either FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC or FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC_WITH_INDICES). Unlike invoking IFactorTableBase.isDeterministicDirected(), this will not check the values of the table or change the representation.

      • getEnergiesSparseUnsafe

        double[] getEnergiesSparseUnsafe()
        Returns the underlying array of sparse energies without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include sparse energies (@link IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies()).

        See Also:
        getWeightsSparseUnsafe()

      • getEnergiesDenseUnsafe

        double[] getEnergiesDenseUnsafe()
        Returns the underlying array of dense energies without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include dense weights

        Since:
        0.07

      • getEnergySlice

        double[] getEnergySlice(int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Returns an array of energies for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.

        Same as getEnergySlice(double[], int, int[]) but always allocates a new array.

        See Also:
        getWeightSlice(int, int[])

      • getEnergySlice

        double[] getEnergySlice(int sliceDimension,
                      Value... values)

      • getEnergySlice

        double[] getEnergySlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Returns an array of energies for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.
        Parameters:
        sliceDimension - is an integer in the range [0, IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()-1] that identifies which domain the slice is for.
        indices - specifies the element indices that are to be fixed. The element index at position sliceDimension will be ignored.
        slice - if non-null and large enough to accommodate the values will be used as the return value, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        Returns:
        an array of energy values with size equal to the size of the sliceDimension of the table (i.e. getDomainIndexer().getDomainSize(sliceDimension)) holding the energy values from the table

        See Also:
        getEnergySlice(int, int[]), getWeightSlice(double[], int, int[])

      • getEnergySlice

        double[] getEnergySlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slize,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      Value... values)

      • getIndicesSparseUnsafe

        int[][] getIndicesSparseUnsafe()
        Returns the underlying array of sparse element indices.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include sparse indices (see hasSparseIndices()) and if the table did not previously only had a dense value representation (see IFactorTableBase.hasDenseRepresentation()) it will implicitly add a sparse representation introducing sparse weights if the table had dense weights and otherwise introducing sparse energies.

      • getWeightForSparseIndex

        double getWeightForSparseIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Returns weight of factor table entry at given sparseIndex.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include a sparse form if it previously only held dense values; in this case, if the table only held dense energies, then sparse energies will be added, otherwise sparse weights will be added.

        Specified by:
        getWeightForSparseIndex in interface IFactorTableBase
        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - should be value less than IFactorTableBase.sparseSize() specifying which table entry to access.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getWeightForIndices(int...), IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForSparseIndex(int)

      • getWeightsSparseUnsafe

        double[] getWeightsSparseUnsafe()
        Returns the underlying array of sparse weights without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include sparse weights (@link IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies()).

        See Also:
        getEnergiesSparseUnsafe()

      • getWeightsDenseUnsafe

        double[] getWeightsDenseUnsafe()
        Returns the underlying array of dense weights without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include dense weights

        Since:
        0.06

      • getWeightSlice

        double[] getWeightSlice(int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Returns an array of weights for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.

        Same as getWeightSlice(double[], int, int[]) but always allocates a new array.

        See Also:
        getEnergySlice(int, int[])

      • getWeightSlice

        double[] getWeightSlice(int sliceDimension,
                      Value... values)

      • getWeightSlice

        double[] getWeightSlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Returns an array of weights for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.
        Parameters:
        sliceDimension - is an integer in the range [0, IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()-1] that identifies which domain the slice is for.
        indices - specifies the element indices that are to be fixed. The element index at position sliceDimension will be ignored.
        slice - if non-null and large enough to accommodate the values will be used as the return value, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        Returns:
        an array of weight values with size equal to the size of the sliceDimension of the table (i.e. getDomainIndexer().getDomainSize(sliceDimension)) holding the weight values from the table

        See Also:
        getWeightSlice(int, int[]), getEnergySlice(double[], int, int[])

      • getWeightSlice

        double[] getWeightSlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      Value... values)

      • hasSparseIndices

        boolean hasSparseIndices()
        True if the current factor table representation supports getIndicesSparseUnsafe().

      • replaceEnergiesSparse

        void replaceEnergiesSparse(double[] energies)
        Replace the energies/weights of the table from the given array of energies in order of sparse index. This does not alter the sparse to joint index mapping.

        See Also:
        replaceWeightsSparse(double[])

      • replaceWeightsSparse

        void replaceWeightsSparse(double[] weights)
        Replace the energies/weights of the table from the given array of weights in order of sparse index. This does not alter the sparse to joint index mapping.

        See Also:
        replaceEnergiesSparse(double[])

      • setEnergiesDense

        void setEnergiesDense(double[] energies)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_ENERGY with provided energies replacing the existing contents of the table.
        Parameters:
        energies - specifies the energies of the table in dense joint-index order. Must have length equal to IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().getCardinality().

      • setWeightsDense

        void setWeightsDense(double[] weights)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_WEIGHT with provided weights replacing the existing contents of the table.
        Parameters:
        weights - specifies the weights of the table in dense joint-index order. Must have length equal to IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().getCardinality().

      • setConditional

        void setConditional(java.util.BitSet outputSet)
        Makes table directed and verifies that its weights are normalized correctly.

        Similar to setDirected(BitSet) but does not allow a null argument and will throw an exception if not IFactorTableBase.isConditional().

      • makeConditional

        void makeConditional(java.util.BitSet outputSet)
        Makes table directed and normalizes its weights to conditional form if necessary.

        Equivalent to calling setDirected(BitSet) followed by IFactorTableBase.normalizeConditional() but requires that outputSet is non-null.

      • randomizeWeights

        void randomizeWeights(java.util.Random rand)
        Randomize the weights of the table depending on underlying representation.

        If table IFactorTableBase.hasDenseRepresentation() this will randomly assign weights/energies to entries for all joint indexes, otherwise it will only assign values for all sparse indexes. Weights will be assigned uniformly from the range (0,1].

      • serializeToXML

        @Deprecated
void serializeToXML(java.lang.String serializeName,
                             java.lang.String targetDirectory)
        Deprecated. 

      • setDeterministicOutputIndices

        void setDeterministicOutputIndices(int[] outputIndices)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC with given set of outputs.

        Parameters:
        outputIndices - any array mapping input indices, representing the joint value of all input values, to output indices, representing the joint value of all outputs. The length of the array must be equal to the value of JointDomainIndexer.getInputCardinality() on IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not IFactorTableBase.isDirected().

      • setDirected

        void setDirected(@Nullable
               java.util.BitSet outputSet)
        Designates directionality of factor table by specifying which of its domains are outputs.

        Note that this may change the indexing of the table's values in both sparse and dense formats. You can only rely on the indexing not to change if all output domains are at the front of the domain list (i.e. JointDomainIndexer.hasCanonicalDomainOrder()).

        Parameters:
        outputSet - if null, makes the table undirected otherwise this should turn on bits corresponding to the domains that are to be designated as outputs. The highest bit must be less than the number of domains (IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()).

      • setEnergyForJointIndex

        void setEnergyForJointIndex(double energy,
                          int jointIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified jointIndex to the given energy value.

        If the representation started out as deterministic (hasDeterministicRepresentation()) and the energy changed, it will be implicitly converted to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_ENERGY and if FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC_WITH_INDICES it will be converted to FactorTableRepresentation.ALL_ENERGY_WITH_INDICES.

        Specified by:
        setEnergyForJointIndex in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setEnergyForSparseIndex

        void setEnergyForSparseIndex(double energy,
                           int sparseIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified sparseIndex to the given energy value.

        If the representation started out as deterministic (hasDeterministicRepresentation()) and the energy changed, it will be converted to sparse energies (retaining sparse indices if they exist).

        Specified by:
        setEnergyForSparseIndex in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForJointIndex

        void setWeightForJointIndex(double weight,
                          int jointIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified jointIndex to the given energy value.

        If the representation started out as FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC, it will be and the weight changed, it will be implicitly converted to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_WEIGHT and if FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC_WITH_INDICES it will be converted to FactorTableRepresentation.ALL_WEIGHT_WITH_INDICES.

        Specified by:
        setWeightForJointIndex in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForSparseIndex

        void setWeightForSparseIndex(double weight,
                           int sparseIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified sparseIndex to the given weight value.

        If the representation started out as deterministic (hasDeterministicRepresentation()) and the weight changed, it will be converted to sparse weights (retaining sparse indices if they exist).

        Specified by:
        setWeightForSparseIndex in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setRepresentation

        void setRepresentation(FactorTableRepresentation representation)
        Sets the underlying representation of the table to the specified value.

        Throws:
        DimpleException - If setting representation to a deterministic representation, this method will throw an exception if the table cannot be represented as deterministic (see IFactorTableBase.isDeterministicDirected()) or table does not support joint indexing and a dense representation is requested (see IFactorTableBase.supportsJointIndexing().

      • setEnergiesSparse

        void setEnergiesSparse(int[] jointIndices,
                     double[] energies)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY with provided energies for each joint index.

        Parameters:
        jointIndices - are the joint indexes of the entries to put in the table.
        energies - specifies the energies of the table in the same order as jointIndices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if jointIndices and energies have different lengths, if there are duplicate indices or any of the indices is not in a valid range for the table.
        See Also:
        setEnergiesSparse(int[][], double[]), setWeightsSparse(int[], double[])

      • setEnergiesSparse

        void setEnergiesSparse(int[][] indices,
                     double[] energies)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY with provided weights for each set of indices.

        Parameters:
        indices - are the combined element indices of the entries to put in the table.
        energies - specifies the energies of the table in the same order as indices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if indices and energies have different lengths, if there are duplicate indices or any of the indices is not in a valid range for the table.
        Since:
        0.05
        See Also:
        setEnergiesSparse(int[], double[]), setWeightsSparse(int[][], double[])

      • setWeightsSparse

        void setWeightsSparse(int[] jointIndices,
                    double[] weights)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_WEIGHT with provided weights for each joint index.

        Parameters:
        jointIndices - are the joint indexes of the entries to put in the table.
        weights - specifies the weights of the table in the same order as jointIndices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if jointIndices and weights have different lengths, if there are duplicate indices or any of the indices is not in a valid range for the table.
        See Also:
        setWeightsSparse(int[][], double[]), setEnergiesSparse(int[], double[])

      • setWeightsSparse

        void setWeightsSparse(int[][] indices,
                    double[] weights)
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_WEIGHT with provided weights for each set of indices.

        Parameters:
        indices - are the combined element indices of the entries to put in the table.
        weights - specifies the weights of the table in the same order as indices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if indices and weights have different lengths, if there are duplicate indices or any of the indices is not in a valid range for the table.
        See Also:
        setWeightsSparse(int[], double[]), setEnergiesSparse(int[][], double[])
